titleStmt.title: William Kirkland v. William Billings. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: William Kirkland v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Wm Billings Sheriff of Thurston County being first duly sworn, on his oath makes the following return on the attached writ of Habeas Corpus. That he has before the said Judge of the District Court of the 2nd Judicial district of W.T. the body of William Kirkland as by said writ directed. That he restrains said Kirkland by virtue of a certain warrant of commitment to him directed by H.D. Taylor Esq. a Justice of the Peace in and for the County of Chehalis W.T. of which the following is a true copy.
Territory of Washington County of Chehalis } ss

To the Sheriff of said County and to the keeper of common jail of Thurston County. Whereas on the twelfth day of May 1872 Edward Campbell made complaint in writing and on oath before the un- dersigned one of the Justices of the Peace in and for said County charging William Kirkland with having on the eighth day of May A.D. 1872 committed the crime of murder and the said William Kirkland having been brought before and examined by me, and it being sufficiently proven to me that the said WIlliam Kirkland has in said county committed the crime of murder by killing Andrew J. Campbell on the Eighth day of May A.D. 1872. Therefore in the name of The United States, you the said Sheriff are com- manded forthwith to convey and deliver the said William Kirkland to the said keeper, and you the said keeper are hereby commanded to safely keep the said William Kirkland to appear and answer at the next Term of the District Court of the aforesaid charge.
Given under my hand this 12th day of May A.D. 1872 H.D. Taylor Justice of the Peace
William Billings Sheriff of Thurston Co. W.T.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 7th day of September 1872 J H Houghton Clerk
Territory of Washington ex relations William Kirkland vs William Billings
